name: Arberry
text: Ta Sin Mim

name: Arberry
text: Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.

name: Arberry
text: Perchance thou consumest thyself that they are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: If We will, We shall send down on them out of heaven a sign, so their necks will stay humbled to it.

name: Arberry
text: But never fresh remembrance comes to them from the All-merciful, except they turn away from it.

name: Arberry
text: So they have cried lies; therefore assuredly tidings will come to them of that they mocked at.

name: Arberry
text: What, have they not regarded the earth, how many therein We have caused to grow of every generous kind?

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: And when thy Lord called to Moses, 'Go to the people of the evildoers,

name: Arberry
text: the people of Pharaoh; will they not be godfearing?'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'My Lord, I fear they will cry me lies,

name: Arberry
text: and my breast will be straitened, and my tongue will not be loosed; so send to Aaron.

name: Arberry
text: They also have a sin against me, and I fear they will slay me.'

name: Arberry
text: Said He, 'No indeed; but go, both of you, with Our signs, and We assuredly shall be with you, listening.

name: Arberry
text: So go you to Pharaoh, and say, "Verily, I am the Messenger of the Lord of all Being;

name: Arberry
text: so send forth with us the Children of Israel."

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'Did we not raise thee amongst us as a child? Didst thou not tarry among us years of thy life?

name: Arberry
text: And thou didst the deed thou didst, being one of the ungrateful!'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'Indeed I did it then, being one of those that stray;

name: Arberry
text: so I fled from you, fearing you. But my Lord gave me Judgment and made me one of the Envoys.

name: Arberry
text: That is a blessing thou reproachest me with, having enslaved the Children of Israel.'

name: Arberry
text: Pharaoh said, 'And what is the Lord of all Being?'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'The Lord of the heavens and earth, and what between them is, if you have faith.'

name: Arberry
text: Said he to those about him, 'Do you not hear?'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients.'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'Surely your Messenger who was sent to you is possessed!'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'The Lord of the East and West, and what between them is, if you have understanding,'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'If thou takest a god other than me, I shall surely make thee one of the imprisoned.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'What, even though I brought thee something so manifest?'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'Bring it then, if thou art of the truthful.'

name: Arberry
text: So he cast his staff, and behold, it was a serpent manifest.

name: Arberry
text: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it was white to the beholders.

name: Arberry
text: Said he to the Council about him, 'Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer

name: Arberry
text: who desires to expel you from your land by his sorcery; what do you command?'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'Put him and his brother off a while, and send among the cities musterers,

name: Arberry
text: to bring thee every cunning sorcerer.

name: Arberry
text: So the sorcerers were assembled for the appointed time of a fixed day.

name: Arberry
text: The people were asked, 'Will you assemble?

name: Arberry
text: Haply we shall follow the sorcerers if it should be they are the victors.'

name: Arberry
text: Then, when the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, 'Shall we indeed have a wage, if we should be the victors?'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'Yes indeed; and you shall then be among the near-stationed.'

name: Arberry
text: Moses said to them, 'Cast you down what you will cast.'

name: Arberry
text: So they cast their ropes and their staffs, and said, 'By the might of Pharaoh we shall be the victors.'

name: Arberry
text: Then Moses cast his staff and lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention;

name: Arberry
text: so the sorcerers were cast down, bowing themselves.

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of all Being,

name: Arberry
text: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.'

name: Arberry
text: Said Pharaoh, 'You have believed him before I gave you leave. Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; now you shall know! I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you all together.'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'There is no harm; surely unto our Lord we are turning.

name: Arberry
text: We are eager that our Lord should forgive us our offences, for that we are the first of the believers.'

name: Arberry
text: Also We revealed unto Moses, 'Go with My servants by night; surely you will be followed.'

name: Arberry
text: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities musterers:

name: Arberry
text: 'Behold, these are a small troop,

name: Arberry
text: and indeed they are enraging us;

name: Arberry
text: and we are a host on our guard.'

name: Arberry
text: So We expelled them from gardens and fountains,

name: Arberry
text: and treasures and a noble station;

name: Arberry
text: even so, and We bequeathed them upon the Children of Israel.

name: Arberry
text: Then they followed them at the sunrise;

name: Arberry
text: and, when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, 'We are overtaken!'

name: Arberry
text: Said he, 'No indeed; surely my Lord is with me; He will guide me.'

name: Arberry
text: Then We revealed to Moses, 'Strike with thy staff the sea'; and it clave, and each part was as a mighty mount.

name: Arberry
text: And there We brought the others on,

name: Arberry
text: and We delivered Moses and those with him all together;

name: Arberry
text: then We drowned the others.

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham

name: Arberry
text: when he said to his father and his people, 'What do you serve?'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'We serve idols, and continue cleaving to them.

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'Do they hear you when you call,

name: Arberry
text: or do they profit you, or harm?'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'Nay, but we found our fathers so doing.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'And have you considered what you have been serving,

name: Arberry
text: you and your fathers, the elders?

name: Arberry
text: They are an enemy to me, except the Lord of all Being

name: Arberry
text: who created me, and Himself guides me,

name: Arberry
text: and Himself gives me to eat and drink,

name: Arberry
text: and, whenever I am sick, heals me,

name: Arberry
text: who makes me to die, then gives me life,

name: Arberry
text: and who I am eager shall forgive me my offence on the Day of Doom.

name: Arberry
text: My Lord, give me Judgment, and join me with the righteous,

name: Arberry
text: and appoint me a tongue of truthfulness among the others.

name: Arberry
text: Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss

name: Arberry
text: and forgive my father, for he is one of those astray.

name: Arberry
text: Degrade me not upon the day when they are raised up,

name: Arberry
text: the day when neither wealth nor sons shall profit

name: Arberry
text: except for him who comes to God with a pure heart.

name: Arberry
text: And Paradise shall be brought forward for the godfearing,

name: Arberry
text: and Hell advanced for the perverse.

name: Arberry
text: It shall be said to them, 'Where is that you were serving

name: Arberry
text: apart from God? Do they help you or help themselves?'

name: Arberry
text: Then they shall be pitched into it, they and the perverse

name: Arberry
text: and the hosts of Iblis, all together.

name: Arberry
text: They shall say, as they dispute there one with another,

name: Arberry
text: 'By God, we were certainly in manifest error

name: Arberry
text: when we made you equal with the Lord of all Being.

name: Arberry
text: It was naught but the sinners that led us astray;

name: Arberry
text: so now we have no intercessors,

name: Arberry
text: no loyal friend.

name: Arberry
text: O that we might return again, and be among the believers!'

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: The people of Noah cried lies to the Envoys

name: Arberry
text: when their brother Noah said to them, 'Will you not be godfearing?

name: Arberry
text: I am for you a faithful Messenger,

name: Arberry
text: so serve you God, and obey you me.

name: Arberry
text: I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being;

name: Arberry
text: so fear you God, and obey you me.'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'Shall we believe thee, whom the vilest follow?'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'What knowledge have I of that they have been doing?

name: Arberry
text: Their account falls only upon my Lord, were you but aware.

name: Arberry
text: I would not drive away the believers;

name: Arberry
text: 'I am naught but a plain warner.'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'If thou givest not over, Noah, thou shalt assuredly be one of the stoned.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'My Lord, my people have cried me lies,

name: Arberry
text: so give true deliverance between me and them, and deliver me and the believers that are with me.

name: Arberry
text: So We delivered him, and those with him, in the laden ship,

name: Arberry
text: then afterwards We drowned the rest.

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: Ad cried lies to the Envoys

name: Arberry
text: when their brother Hood said to them, 'Will you not be godfearing?

name: Arberry
text: I am for you a faithful Messenger,

name: Arberry
text: so fear you God, and obey you me.

name: Arberry
text: I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.

name: Arberry
text: What, do you build on every prominence a sign, sporting,

name: Arberry
text: and do you take to you castles, haply to dwell forever?

name: Arberry
text: When you assault, you assault like tyrants!

name: Arberry
text: So fear you God, and obey you me;

name: Arberry
text: and fear Him who has succoured you with what you know,

name: Arberry
text: succoured you with flocks and sons,

name: Arberry
text: gardens and fountains.

name: Arberry
text: 'Indeed, I fear for you the chastisement of a dreadful day.'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'Alike it is to us, whether thou admonishest, or art not one of the admonishers;

name: Arberry
text: this is nothing but the habit of the ancients,

name: Arberry
text: and we shall not be chastised.'

name: Arberry
text: So they cried him lies; then We destroyed them. Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: Thamood cried lies to the Envoys

name: Arberry
text: when their brother Salih said to them, 'Will you not be godfearing?

name: Arberry
text: I am for you a faithful Messenger,

name: Arberry
text: so fear you God, and obey you me.'

name: Arberry
text: 'I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.

name: Arberry
text: Will you be left secure in this here,

name: Arberry
text: among gardens and fountains,

name: Arberry
text: sown fields, and palms with slender spathes?

name: Arberry
text: Will you still skilfully hew houses out of the mountains?

name: Arberry
text: So fear you God, and obey you me;

name: Arberry
text: and obey not the commandment of the prodigal

name: Arberry
text: who do corruption in the earth, and set not things aright.'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'Thou art merely one of those that are bewitched;

name: Arberry
text: thou art naught but a mortal, like us; then produce a sign, if thou art one of the truthful.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'This is a she-camel; to her a draught and to you a draught, on a day appointed,

name: Arberry
text: and do not touch her with malice so that there seize you the chastisement of a dreadful day.'

name: Arberry
text: But they hamstrung her, and in the morning they were remorseful,

name: Arberry
text: and the chastisement seized them. Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: The people of Lot cried lies to the Envoys

name: Arberry
text: when their brother Lot said to them, 'Will you not be godfearing?

name: Arberry
text: I am for you a faithful Messenger,

name: Arberry
text: so fear you God, and obey you me.

name: Arberry
text: I ask of you no wage for this; my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.

name: Arberry
text: What, do you come to male beings,

name: Arberry
text: leaving your wives that your Lord created for you? Nay, but you are a people of transgressors.

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'If thou givest not over, Lot, thou shalt assuredly be one of the expelled.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'Truly I am a detester of what you do.

name: Arberry
text: My Lord, deliver me and my people from that they do.'

name: Arberry
text: So We delivered him and his people all together,

name: Arberry
text: save an old woman among those that tarried;

name: Arberry
text: then We destroyed the others,

name: Arberry
text: and We rained on them a rain; and evil is the rain of them that are warned.

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: The men of the Thicket cried lies to the Envoys

name: Arberry
text: when Shuaib said to them, 'Will you not be godfearing?

name: Arberry
text: I am for you a faithful Messenger, so fear you God, and obey you me.

name: Arberry
text: I ask of you no wage for this;

name: Arberry
text: my wage falls only upon the Lord of all Being.

name: Arberry
text: Fill up the measure, and be not cheaters,

name: Arberry
text: and weigh with the straight balance,

name: Arberry
text: and diminish not the goods of the people, and do not mischief in the earth, working corruption.

name: Arberry
text: Fear Him who created you, and the generations of the ancients.'

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'Thou art merely one of those that are bewitched;

name: Arberry
text: thou art naught but a mortal, like us; indeed, we think that thou art one of the liars.

name: Arberry
text: Then drop down on us lumps from heaven, if thou art one of the truthful.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'My Lord knows very well what you are doing.'

name: Arberry
text: But they cried him lies; then there seized them the chastisement of the Day of Shadow; assuredly it was the chastisement of a dreadful day.

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

name: Arberry
text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

name: Arberry
text: Truly it is the revelation of the Lord of all Being,

name: Arberry
text: brought down by the Faithful Spirit

name: Arberry
text: upon thy heart, that thou mayest be one of the warners,

name: Arberry
text: in a clear, Arabic tongue.

name: Arberry
text: Truly it is in the Scriptures of the ancients.

name: Arberry
text: Was it not a sign for them, that it is known to the learned of the Children of Israel?

name: Arberry
text: If We had sent it down on a barbarian

name: Arberry
text: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

name: Arberry
text: Even so We have caused it to enter into the hearts of the sinners,

name: Arberry
text: who will not believe in it, until they see the painful chastisement

name: Arberry
text: so that it will come upon them suddenly, while they are not aware,

name: Arberry
text: and they will say, 'Shall we be respited?'

name: Arberry
text: What, do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

name: Arberry
text: What thinkest thou? If We give them enjoyment of days for many years,

name: Arberry
text: then there comes on them that they were promised,

name: Arberry
text: what will it then avail them, the enjoyment of days they were given?

name: Arberry
text: Never a city We destroyed, but it had warners

name: Arberry
text: for a reminder; and never did We wrong.

name: Arberry
text: Not by the Satans has it been brought down;

name: Arberry
text: it behoves them not, neither are they able.

name: Arberry
text: Truly, they are expelled from hearing.

name: Arberry
text: So call thou not upon another god with God, lest thou shouldst be one of those that are chastised.

name: Arberry
text: And warn thy clan, thy nearest kin.

name: Arberry
text: Lower thy wing to those who follow thee, being believers;

name: Arberry
text: then, if they disobey thee, say, 'I am quit of that you do.'

name: Arberry
text: Put thy trust in the All-mighty, the All-compassionate

name: Arberry
text: who sees thee when thou standest

name: Arberry
text: and when thou turnest about among those who bow.

name: Arberry
text: Surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

name: Arberry
text: Shall I tell you on whom the Satans come down?

name: Arberry
text: They come down on every guilty impostor.

name: Arberry
text: They give ear, but most of them are liars.

name: Arberry
text: And the poets -- the perverse follow them;

name: Arberry
text: hast thou not seen how they wander in every valley

name: Arberry
text: and how they say that which they do not?

name: Arberry
text: Save those that believe, and do righteous deeds, and remember God oft, and help themselves after being wronged; and those who do wrong shall surely know by what overturning they will he overturned.
